descript.abstract: Landing sites in St. Vincent and the Grenadines. At time of completion, the attribute table was incomplete pending more research by TNC and the Fisheries Division. "No Data" values are represented as "-9999" in the attribute table.
descript.purpose: Developed to locate and visualize fish landing sites in St. Vincent and the Grenadines. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project about the impact of inundation on economically important places like fish landing sites. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Country Code 2 - 4 digit country identifier, same as calling code
Census Division Code - Unique 2 digit CD identifier
Unique census division identifier consisting of 4 digit country code, and 2 digit CD Code
Name of island where feature is located
Number of fishers each landing site represents
Number of fishers who are 15 years old and under
Number of fishers between 16 and 25 years old
Category of landing site (Primary, Secondary, Tertiary)
